description: Tautology laws deal with expressions involving TRUE. A tautology is always true regardless of other values. "P or TRUE" always equals TRUE (since at least TRUE is true). "P and TRUE" simplifies to just P (since TRUE doesn't restrict P). These laws help simplify expressions with constant truth values.
rule_pattern: P ∨ TRUE ⊢ TRUE, P ∧ TRUE ⊢ P

problems.solution: Apply Tautology law: P or TRUE is always TRUE since TRUE is always true.
